Row.Text: This option allows you to set the start bias for this player. The game only creates a limited number of starting plots so the actual starting location is not guaranteed.

Copy this starting Gold value to all other players.

The number of Terrain plots that will be added by this command (if possible).
Water can not be changed to Land and Land can not be changed to Water unless this box is checked.
This determines how the mod will search for a suitable tile when placing Terrain.
Terrain will be placed at least this far from the player's starting position.
Terrain will be placed no further than this distance from the player's starting position.
Use these buttons to control the elevation when creating Terrain.
The currently selected Terrain has no elevation.
Adds a Resource command to this list using the current settings.
The number of Features that will be added by this command (if possible).
The command will only replace existing features if this box is checked.

Features will be placed at least this far from the player's starting position.
Features will be placed no further than this distance from the player's starting position.
Adds a Feature command to this list using the current settings.
The number of Resources that will be added by this command (if possible).
Normally Resource placement is limited by Terrain, Hills, and Features. If this box is checked then some of these limits will be ignored.
This determines how the mod will search for a suitable tile when placing a Resource.
Resources will be placed at least this far from the player's starting position.
Resources will be placed no further than this distance from the player's starting position.
Use these buttons to control what appears in the Resource menu.
Adds a Resource command to this list using the current settings.
The number of Natural Wonders that will be added by this command (if possible).
If this box is checked then the command will sprinkle a random number of resources around the Natural Wonder.
This determines how the mod will search for a suitable tile when placing a Natural Wonder.
Natural Wonders will be placed at least this far from the player's starting position.
Natural Wonders will be placed no further than this distance from the player's starting position.

This number of Units that will be added by this command (if possible).
Units will be given this amount of experience.
If this box is checked then Units from eras that are later than the currently selected start era will be shown in the Unit menu.
If this box is checked then unique Units that are normally not available for the currently selected civilization will be shown in the Unit menu.
Use these buttons to control what appears in the Unit menu.
If this box is checked only non combat Units will be shown in the Unit menu.
If this box is checked both combat and non-combat Units will be shown in the Unit menu.

This opens up the Edit Player Name box which allows you to change this Player's Leader and Civilization names.
This resets all player name's back to their default value. This button is disabled when all players are using their default names.
Moves to the previous player in the player list.
Moves to the next player in the player list.
Set all Map Bonus options to their default values.
This controls the number of City States that will appear on the map. This option is not available when Random Map Size is selected.
This affects how much of the map is visible to each player when the game starts. The value indicates the distance in plots from the player's starting position.
This causes the whole map to be visible for all players when the game starts.
This disables ALL Natural Wonders in the game.
This disables all Natural Wonders not created by this mod.
Use this to set the maximum number of copies allowed for each type of Natural Wonder.
Only selected Civs will appear in the game.
Set all Map options to their default values.

Selecting this option will allow a game to be played where one or more Civs start without settlers. You achieve this by manually creating the player's starting units in the edit player panel and omitting settlers. Any player without a starting settler that starts in a isolated position where they have no cities to attack will be given a settler.
Selecting this option disables building the Manhattan Project and nuclear weapons. Nuclear weapons can still be given manually to players by using the player unit panel in this mod.
Set all Game options to their default values.
